results.title: Down the up ladder
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, George Cass and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Traces the history and current professional development of marine engineering in Australia. Profiles the work aboard a large ferry, a naval destroyer and a hydrofoil. Also examines the role of electronics in mechanical systems.

results.title: Remedial reading; Helping you to help your child
results.creator_credit: Bill Cole and Audiovisual Centre, University of Auckland
results.brief_description: Remedial reading: a family affair [22:00] deals with a research project in the Mangere district of South Auckland which aimed to clarify parental willingness to assist their children with reading difficulties, how they could be helped and whether this assistance was of lasting benefit. “Helping you to help your child” [23:00] introduces parents to the essential components in tutoring children: praising, problem solving, pausing and beginnings. The program is directed towards parents of older children who have reading difficulties.

results.title: Mawson Base: face to face
results.creator_credit: Ian Toohill, Rob McCubbin, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production
results.brief_description: Shot mainly around the Mawson area and narrated by Dr Phillip Law, this film looks at Antartica through the eyes of the expedition’s cook and the doctor. Raises issues on the future of Antartica and gives insight into the daily pressures of life in isolation. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Toohill, Rob McCubbin, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production

results.title: Cattle king
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett and Bill Bennett Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Sir Sydney Kidman and his battle with the Australian land. Kidman began as a roustabout and eventually came to control over a hundred properties and owned more cattle than any other person in the world. He attempted to avoid the full effects of Australia’s periodical droughts by buying up territories covering a wide area of Northern Australia. His policy was put to the test in 1901-1902 and 1926-30; his battle with the droughts of these years is dramatically portrayed.

results.title: Torvill and Dean: path to perfection
results.brief_description: Chronicles the rise of world ice-skating champions Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean. Shows eight dance routines from the World Championships in 1980, 1982 and 1983, the European championships from Budapest and the Williams and Glynn Gala in 1982.

results.title: Botanic man. - Volume 3: Episodes 8-10.
results.creator_credit: Graeme Duckham, Robert Fleming, Randal Beattie and Thames Television International
results.brief_description: A compilation of David Bellamy’s “Life on the limit”, Extinction is forever”, and “Crackpot jackpot”. Contents include the ecological consequences of agriculture, the extinction of species, and the human role in evolution.

results.title: Botanic man. - Volume 2: Episodes 5-7.
results.creator_credit: Graeme Duckham, Robert Fleming, Randal Beattie and Thames Television International
results.brief_description: A compilation of David Bellamy’s “Land of opportunity”, “Latitude zero”, and “White death: new life”. Contents include the botanical uniqueness of New Zealand, the role of animals in plant reproduction, the ecological contrasts of Ecuador’s Andes, and the glacial origins of Canada’s wheatlands.
